image.altText: Shorthead seahorses found washed up at Hallett Cove.

props.synopsis: An independent group of marine scientists from around Australia has released a seven-point plan to tackle what it describes as South Australia's "catastrophic" toxic algal bloom.

title.children: Seven steps scientists say will tackle toxic algal bloom

image.altText: A beekeeper holds a comb in his hand covered in bees.

props.synopsis: South Australian beekeepers are already battling drought and low prices â€” the last thing they need is a bee-killing parasite, which has stayed out of the state so far.

title.children: Varroa mite anxiety heightens as bee hives move for crop pollination

image.altText: Aerial view of highway with a few residences pictured on the ground.

props.synopsis: A tourism business has lodged an appeal against a decision to approve a nearly billion-dollar energy storage project outside Broken Hill, saying light and noise will impact its business.

title.children: Outback stargazing business fights approval of $1b energy project

image.altText: generic photo of psychologist's hand holding a pen with a patient

props.synopsis: Ramsay Health Care are set to close 17 of their 20 psychology clinics across the country potentially leaving thousands of vulnerable patients in limbo.

title.children: Patients potentially in limbo as Ramsay Health closes psychology clinics

image.altText: Missing man Michael Jeffrey Purse.

props.synopsis: A gap in South Australia's prison placement guidelines is set to close after calls for change from the family of murder victim Michael Purse who was killed in 2019.

title.children: Gap to close in SA's prison placement rules after plea from murder victim's family

image.altText: A worker at the face of the blast furnace at the Whyalla steelworks.

props.synopsis: The SA government says it will not have to spend as much money as it initially planned to keep the Whyalla steelworks operating through administration, with a $384 million contingency fund revised down to $275 million.

title.children: Whyalla steelworks costing less than anticipated to run, but extra $275m still needed

image.altText: A man with short brown hair wearing a black tshirt is kneeling down and patting a dog.

props.synopsis: Police have seized an Elvis T-shirt, drink bottle and a wristband from Port Lincoln scrubland on Wednesday as their search continues for the missing remains of the alleged murder victim.

title.children: Police seize Elvis T-shirt and other items in Julian Story search

image.altText: Water surrounds houses on a suburban street.

props.synopsis: There has been flooding and infrastructure damage in coastal towns in SA again and more bad weather is on the way.

title.children: Fears of 'new norm' as SA towns battered by another storm

image.altText: An emaciated teenage boy lying in a hospital bed with his mother by his side.

props.synopsis: In a ward of Gaza City's Shifa Hospital, multiple children and some adults can be found emaciated from the lack of food. Doctors say the rate of death from starvation is rapidly rising.

title.children: Weighing just 10kg at 14 years old: 'Major starvation' takes hold in Gaza

image.altText: David Littleproud press conference with National Party leadership - 2025-05-20 13:03:02

props.synopsis: Australia has lifted the remaining biosecurity restrictions on US beef in a move the government could use to negotiate the removal of trade tariffs. Follow live.

title.children: Coalition questions if US beef decision designed to appease Trump

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Farrell says US trade chief didn't raise beef with him in meetings just weeks ago
Littleproud questions if US beef decision was 'traded away to appease Trump'
Cattle Australia 'comfortable' with decision on US beef

image.altText: Donald Trump, Melania Knauss, Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell pose for a photograph in a party

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump was allegedly told his name was in the Epstein files multiple times, according to senior administration officials who spoke to The Wall Street Journal.

title.children: Trump reportedly told his name in Epstein files

image.altText: A man in a singlet looks at the camera.

props.synopsis: A retrial has found Benjamin John Mitchell and three other men guilty of murdering a man during a cannabis theft at a home in Adelaide's northern suburbs almost seven years ago.

title.children: Four found guilty for second time of murdering Albanian refugee

image.altText: A man in a stripe top and dark jacket walks outside a court building

props.synopsis: A driver accused of killing his passenger in a rollover north of Adelaide was captured on his own dash cam veering out of his lane 26 times in the 20 minutes before the fatal crash, a court has heard.

title.children: 'Lethargic' driver veers out of lane repeatedly before deadly crash, court hears

image.altText: Dirty pig standing in mud in piggery

props.synopsis: Fourteen pigs have been put down and 21 Animal Welfare Notices have been issued to a piggery outside Adelaide following leaked footage from inside the facility appearing to show alleged animal abuse.

title.children: Over a dozen pigs euthanased as animal welfare investigation continues

image.altText: A huge tree lies across a road in a suburban area

props.synopsis: Residents say a freak tornado that ripped through Perth's coastal suburbs sounded "like a jet engine" as it fell trees and tore up the roofs of homes.

title.children: Freak tornado 'like a jet engine' damages homes in Perth

image.altText: A child sits on a wall with a bike nearby

props.synopsis: A new report from Victoria Legal Aid reveals a rise in the number of children being placed on violence intervention orders, with some as young as 10 years old.

title.children: 'How does this help?' Families fight intervention orders forced on their child

image.altText: Two middle aged men in suits

props.synopsis: The Tasmanian Liberals say Labor should concede the Tasmanian election, as both parties continue discussions with crossbenchers.

title.children: Liberals call on Labor to concede Tasmanian election

image.altText: A photo of the City of Nedlands sign with the postcode 6009 included

props.synopsis: The referral is for a separate matter aside from recent controversies including the council refusing to give up land for a children's hospice and four councillors resigning in a day.

title.children: City of Nedlands referred to Corruption and Crime Commission

image.altText: Rows of babies in cardboard boxes strapped into the seats of a commercial aeroplane.

props.synopsis:
In the closing weeks of the Vietnam War, hundreds of orphaned babies and children were airlifted to Australia for a new life, but not all of them were adopted.

Â

title.children: In 1975, hundreds of babies were put in boxes and flown to Australia

image.altText: Signs outside a courthouse read "Supreme Court" and "District Court".

props.synopsis: An unnamed hospital applied to the Supreme Court for orders after being asked to perform a surgical termination for the child who was about nine weeks pregnant.

title.children: Hospital given permission by Supreme Court to terminate 12yo's pregnancy

image.altText: A man posing alongside a young girl. Both are smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: The UK tech tycoon Mike Lynch, who died last year when his luxury yacht sank in Sicily, had always maintained his innocence.

title.children: Court rules Mike Lynch's estate and former Autonomy partner owe HP over $1b

image.altText: aerial view of cleared land at a proposed mine site.

props.synopsis: The mining company has defended its actions at the proposed Gemini mine site in central Queensland, and says work has been done in accordance with state and federal laws.

title.children: Mining company allegedly begins clearing land for unapproved mine

image.altText: Illustration of lizard-like creatures, each with a striped crest made of long feather-like structures on its back.

props.synopsis: A strange crest found on ancient reptile fossils suggests birds and dinosaurs may not have the exclusive lock on feather-like features.

title.children: 'Wondrous reptile' fossil discovery deepens feather evolution puzzle

image.altText: Protesters hold banners supporting recall vote.

props.synopsis: China is "clearly" trying to interfere in Taiwan's democracy and it is up to Taiwan's people to decide who should be removed from or stay in office, the island's government says ahead of a recall vote for around one-fifth of politicians.

title.children: Taiwan accuses China of interfering ahead of recall vote

image.altText: A number of police vehicles and a police dive boat parked on a street.

props.synopsis: Residents say they saw the body floating in Currumbin Creek on Wednesday afternoon and reported it to the authorities.

title.children: Woman's body found floating in Gold Coast waterway

image.altText: ATM blurred

props.synopsis: The move follows an ABC investigation which found ATM companies were cutting deals with tobacco criminals.Â

title.children: ABC investigation sparks removal of ATMs from suspected illegal tobacco stores

image.altText: Emmanuel, in a blue suit, raises a hand to acknowledge photographers as Brigitte, in a white skirt suit, holds his arm.

props.synopsis: Candace Owens, a right-wing American podcaster, has repeatedly claimed the French president's wife used to be a man.

title.children: French president sues US influencer over claims his wife was born a man

image.altText: Kids toys on the floor.

props.synopsis: Fill-in childcare workers won't be included in the first stage of Victoria's new childcare worker registration scheme when it begins next month.

title.children: Worries 'red flags' may go undetected when new childcare scheme begins

image.altText: A close-up of Paul Keating's face as he looks up. He is indoors.

props.synopsis: The unusual decision, which came after years of negotiations, provides a rare glimpse into the ATO's inner workings when overturning its own decisions on tax debt.

title.children: ATO reverses decision to bill ex-PM's company $950k

image.altText: Bryan Kohberger dressed in orange jumpsuit in court is sentenced to life in prison

props.synopsis: Kohberger pleaded guilty in order to avoid the death penalty, and on sentencing, the judge acknowledged that the motive may never be known.

title.children: Bryan Kohberger sentenced to life in prison for murdering four Idaho students

image.altText: A crashed plane

props.synopsis: A lawyer says the return of victims' remains had been marred by serious errors, which had been identified following a probe by a British coroner.

title.children: Families of Air India crash victims receive wrong remains

image.altText: Men look at ruins of crash site as police officer walks.

props.synopsis: A teacher is being praised for her bravery after losing her life saving students when a Bangladesh Air Force fighter jet crashed into her school and erupted in a fireball.

title.children: Teacher dies saving students from Bangladesh jet crash inferno

image.altText: A close-up on a man's hand gripping the steering wheel. A mobile phone sits in its mount on the dashboard.

props.synopsis: Insurance company analysis shows lane departure warning and lane keeping assist are the least popular features.

title.children: Do you turn off driver assist tech in your vehicle? You're not alone

image.altText: Houses under construction on a bright, sunny day.

props.synopsis: There is new evidence that rental price growth is easing, potentially putting downward pressure on inflation and interest rates.

title.children: Economists predict interest rate relief as rent growth unexpectedly slows
